turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Goddards.
turn.2: Goddards  Goddards is a large country house in Abinger Common, Surrey, England.
turn.4: The house was designed by Edwin Lutyens in 1898–1900 and later enlarged.
turn.6: It was built "as a Home of Rest to which ladies of small means might repair for holiday" for shipping magnate Frederick Mirrielees.
turn.8: In 1910 Lutyens extended the building and adapted it as a private residence for Mrs D Mirrielees.
turn.9: What interesting features does the article mention?
turn.10: It has an integrated skittle alley and the gardens were designed by Gertrude Jekyll.
turn.11: Is it still a home today?
turn.12: In 1991 Bill Hall bequeathed Goddards to the Lutyens Trust in memory of his architect son, Lee Hall, who died in 1988.
